data.title: Don't Waste Your Time or Your Money Here!
data.text: Don't waste your time with this place!  They are a joke!  Their menu shows you all the sauces that they offer for the sandwiches but don't be fooled by the menu. You are required to use the sauce they want you to. So basically they expect the customer to buy what they want you to rather than what the customer wants.  Why would I waste my money to get something I don't want when I can spend it elsewhere to get what I want?  Imagine how long a company like Subway would have lasted if they treated the customer like this.  So if you are allergic to an ingredient don't expect them to give a care. They wont make a very small change to make your food right.  They obviously don't empower their employees to take care of the customer.  Another issue is their restroom,  The floor is blacker and dirtier then a truck stop restroom.

data.title: Always a light choice
data.text: I love Zupas just for the fact that I can eat plenty without it weighing me down. The soups, salads and sandwich menus have something for everyone. AND they serve diet coke!  You know I'm a fan. Customer service is great. Overly helpful actually. And the tester is always clean and orderly. There is the option to sit outside also. Always good for a lunch meeting or date night dinner.

data.title: Good but dry bread
data.text: I ordered my favorite salad to go and it was delicious, but the bread was dry and tasted old. Very disappointing!!!! The bread to give to customers was just sitting out with no cover, so obviously it will dry out. They need to fix this!!!

data.title: Blown Away
data.text:
Our son suggested we eat here while both my wife and I were not too thrilled we decided to make him happy while thinking to ourselves we would not like it.
We couldn't have been more wrong. I had the Red Pepper, Lobster soup. Wow! A must have. My wife had the Chicken Quinoa Salad and it was delicious. We will definitely return for more.

data.title: Scrumptious Salads
data.text: Ok, this is a regular place, but I only review it about every 4 months. Still a dependable stop for a quick and delicious salad made to order with a smile. The tables are clean. The selection is great.

data.title: Yummy, Affordable & Excellent Service
data.text:
Was on a 20 day tour of USA and stopped for one night at a motel nearby.  Was seriously so over fast food and thought this cafe would be no different but what a pleasant surprise.  Not only was the soups and salads absolutely delicious and healthy, the staff were so wonderful and friendly and the meals were soooo cheap with nothing sacrificed.
Thank you for the wonderful experience in Provo.

data.title: great value
data.text:
We enjoyed the Zupas in Orem for some fantastic salads and soups. Coming from New England I really do not try seafood outside my home area. Let alone have lobster bisque in a desert state. Well, I gotta tell you Zupas prepares a fine bisque, with chunks of lobster and light seasoning as to not overpower the lobster. I also had a salad which was very fresh. The dining room is a large open area with tables and booths scattered about.
The only real issue is that the place could use some acoustic panels to help absorb sound as the place is a bit noisy.

data.title: Delish salad
data.text: It's always hard to find a good Paleo place to eat.  I don't know if it's exactly Paleo with no sugar in the dressing, but the salad was fantastic.  I also got a side soup that was very good.  You choose a sandwich, salad, or soup or combination of the above so it worked for all three of us.

data.title: Always the perfect place to eat.
data.text: We live so close to the Orem Zupa's, but never really ate there much. Then we gave it a try. It is one of our favorite three places to eat. I have gotten the same thing for the last 5 visits because I am hooked.

data.title: Great food and Strawberries dipped in chocolate!
data.text: Great place to eat in, take out or for catering.  If you get catering, make sure you call in the day before.

data.title: Delicious but Busy and Overpriced
data.text: I love the food at Zupas, delicious soup, salad and paninis! However, because it is so popular, it is usually too crowded and noisy, not an environment I enjoy in which to eat my food. Also, the food is overpriced. I ordered a combo, half salad and panini and it cost me $9.50! That is too much for a little cafe food.

data.title: New Items on the Menu
data.text: Zupas is always a great place to enjoy soup, salad, and sandwiches along with a dessert if you want more than the chocolate covered strawberry they give you. They always serve new items, as well.

data.title: Lobster Bisque is Great
data.text: I don't get to Utah very often but when I do I always try to eat at Cafe Zupas.  A great place for a quick and reasonably priced lunch or dinner.  I've sure that the other reviews have described the process of selection from soups, salads and sandwiches.  All I can add is that I haven't been disappointed in the three times that I've eaten there.

data.title: Wouldn't recommend.
data.text: My siblings took me here for the first time and I was excited because everyone raved about the place. The line doesn't take long, but they kind of rush you so you don't have time to really look anything over. The place is small and we were barely lucky to find a table but it was dirty. Their food was mediocre and the only good thing was the chocolate covered strawberry. I was not impressed.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: Awesome great salads, great soups! We always order two soups each that's how good they are/ so two soups and a big salad is a good enough meal!

data.title: Not a fan
data.text: The amount of toppings they put on your salad is seriously laughable.  They are so stingy with their food. It boggles my mind how people think this is such a great place.

data.title: Wonderfully fresh, delicous food!
data.text: I had never been to a Café Zupas before, but came upon one while travelling through Utah.  Yum, yum, yum!  I so wish we had one of these in Michigan!!! I would eat here several times a week!  I had a salad with fruits, candied nuts and a yogurt dressing which was divine!  I also had a bowl of red pepper lobster bisque - so good!  My husband's sandwich and soup were also delicious!  I think he had some kind of chicken enchilada soup or something. Our meals came with a roll and a chocolate covered strawberry!  I thought it was a good price for the value.  Everything tasted so fresh and flavorful!  Definitely two thumbs up for this restaurant!!!

data.title: Great concept of serving Soups/Salads/Sandwiches
data.text: Zupas is based on concept similar to several Mexican chains: Pick two of three options while standing in line then take your food to the table.  But they offer exceptional sandwiches/soups/salads.  Desserts are extra.  Pulled pork sandwiches with Lobster Bisque was excellent.  Everyone at our table was happy with what they order...except my wife who was disappointed with the Tortilla soup.  Another person felt that their brule was more like pudding.  I would go back in a minute.  Hope this chain expands to Colorado where we're from.

data.title: An average Zupas, Usual Food, Lacking Customer Service and Friendly Staff
data.text: I enjoy Zupas on occasion, the food is reasonably good and enjoyable.  The prices do not match the product, I feel they are a tad high for what is delivered.  I have never been impressed with the experience I have had at this location. On several occasions I have had to clean the tables myself or re-clean, after the staff has bused the table. I often get the feeling I'm being served by the soup nazi when going through the line. Please do not get me wrong, the food is the normal delivered at a Zupas, but the delivery of the management and staff is lacking.

data.title: One of our favorite places to eat, but wish the soup was hotter than lukewarm
data.text: Everything about Zupas is terrific except for the fact that nearly every time we eat there, which is quite often, the soup is not as hot as we would like it to be. Their New England Claim Chowder is our favorite soup so we typically order that and a half sandwich to go with it. We would give it an excellent rating if the soup was what we consider hot.
